intro: Lenwebbia prominens, commonly known as the showy orchid, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), which helps it retain moisture in its humid environment. The flowers often have a sweet fragrance, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
